title: ‘There is confusion’: SC directs EC to give details of 3.66 lakh voters deleted from final Bihar electoral roll
'We fear for her life': German town mayor found stabbed at home
description: A newly elected German town mayor, Iris Stalzer, was found severely wounded after a stabbing attack near her home. Chancellor Friedrich Merz condemned the incident as a "heinous act," expressing fears for her life. Stalzer, a member of the Social Democratic Party, was elected just last month. Her son reportedly discovered her seriously injured.

description: IBM Consulting's chief, Mohamad Ali, urges consultancies to transform into software companies to survive the AI era. He warns that traditional models are becoming obsolete due to tech competition and client skepticism.  IBM is developing thousands of digital 'agents' to automate tasks, aiming to convert a significant portion of its business into software delivery.

title: Mumbai: Wife no. 2 says husband 'kidnapped'; found in rehab on order of wife no. 1
description: A Mumbai builder, Chandrakant Bhunu, was reported kidnapped by his second wife, but police found him at a rehabilitation center. The "kidnappers" were employees of the center, hired by Bhunu's first wife who orchestrated the intervention due to his alcoholism. The incident began as a kidnapping drama but concluded as a wellness retreat.

title: Pune’s Pashan records season’s lowest minimum temperature at 18.1°C
PM Modi dials Putin to extend birthday wishes, says looking forward to hosting him in India
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Russian President Putin on his 73rd birthday, reaffirming commitment to deepen the special and privileged strategic partnership. Both leaders reviewed bilateral progress, with PM Modi looking forward to hosting President Putin for the upcoming Annual Summit in New Delhi. Putin expressed confidence in India's sovereign decisions and PM Modi's leadership.

title: Bengaluru filmmaker Hemant arrested over actress’s allegations of sexual misconduct
description: Kannada actor-director-producer B. Hemant Kumar was arrested by Bengaluru Police following a television actress's complaint of sexual harassment, cheating, and blackmail. The actress alleges he spiked her drink, filmed her, and used the footage for extortion, alongside threats and defamation. Investigations are ongoing after the arrest.

description: Cricketer Arjun Tendulkar's sister, Sara, shared a heartwarming video of herself and Arjun's fiancée, Saaniya Chandhok, with their pet dogs, delighting fans. This follows Arjun's 26th birthday celebrations, where Sara posted a playful throwback picture weeks back. The engagement, confirmed by Sachin Tendulkar, has kept fans invested in the family's personal moments, including in this latest post.

description: Ayesha Curry, wife of NBA star Steph Curry, revealed her personal journey. Initially focused on her career, she shifted her priorities to family after marriage and motherhood. Later, she rediscovered her own goals and built a successful career in culinary arts and business. She also co-runs a foundation with Steph Curry.

Shaw's century, alongside Arshin Kulkarni's 186, showcased a strong batting resurgence for the opener.

'Ongoing continuously': India-US in contact at various levels for trade deal
description: India is actively engaged in discussions with the US for a Bilateral Trade Agreement, with Union Minister Piyush Goyal indicating ongoing contact at various levels. Meanwhile, India is pursuing a Free Trade Agreement with the European Union, with both sides expressing optimism for an equitable and balanced pact, aiming for completion by year-end.

title: Nobel Physics Prize for beginners: How 3 physicists built the real 'quantum world'
description: The 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics was handed out to people for pulling off what Marvel writers only pretend to understand: showing that quantum weirdness isn’t confined to subatomic particles. They built real-world circuits that behave like quantum beings — tunnelling through barriers, jumping between energy levels, and proving that Schrödinger’s cat may not be alive or dead, but quantum physics is alive and kicking.

44% drop: How number of Indian students going to US has declined
description: Student arrivals from India fell 44 percent, the sharpest fall among all major source countries. Overall international student arrivals to the US dropped 19 percent, indicating that the fall among Indians is far steeper than the global average. The downturn follows a smaller decline last year, showing a continuing trend rather than a one-time disruption.

title: From Gmail to Zoho: Email switch made easy; guide for effortless migration
description: Zoho Mail is emerging as a popular privacy-focused alternative to Gmail, especially for professionals and small businesses. The service offers custom domain support, an ad-free interface, and enhanced privacy. This guide outlines a simple process to migrate your emails, folders, and contacts from Gmail to Zoho Mail, ensuring no data loss.

title: Bihar elections: How NDA plans to counter oppn caste-based drive; banks on ‘Viksit Bihar’
description: The NDA, led by BJP and JDU, anticipates a strong victory in Bihar polls, campaigning on a platform of development and good governance, aiming to move past the 'Jungle Raj' era. Opinion polls project a landslide win for the alliance, while the opposition INDIA bloc is expected to focus on caste-based politics.
